title: 10. You have an application deployed in a GKE Cluster as a Kubernetes workload with Daemon Sets. Your application has become very popular and is now struggling to cope up with increased traffic. You want to add more pods to your workload and want to ensure your cluster scales up and scales down automatically based on volume. What should you do?
alternatives: A. Enable autoscaling on Kubernetes Engine.
B. Perform a rolling update to modify machine type from 11-standard-2 to n1- – standard-4.
C. Enable Horizontal Pod Autoscaling for the Kubernetes deployment.
D. Create another identical Kubernetes workload and split traffic between the two workloads.
